title.value: DKMS (automatically control updates during release updates)

body.value:
DKMS controls during release updates automatically, if there is software installed which is not coming from the ubuntu repository e.g. ATI / NVIDIA drivers etc.
DMKS should make sure that this 3rd party software should also work after an update â€“ not for 100%, but who guaranties 100%.
Further details on http://wiki.ubuntuusers.de/DKMS
Open a terminal:
sudo apt-get install build-essential dkms (Enter, Passwort, Enter)
DKMS is already installed, if you cloned a laptop or if you used the installscript-software.sh.
